name: Friday Night Latin Jazz Dinner with Noah Abrahamse and The Mumbo Jumbo
description: In their music, you will hear the rhythms of Cuba and Latin America fusing together with elements of the Jazz Tradition.

name: Mixed Media Workshop - Nature Through the Window
description: Design your own window view using an exciting mix of materials like fabrics, yarn, foils, and more. You will create a textured, layered artwork inspired by sunsets, forests, or any natural scene you love. A vibrant & relaxing experience for all skill levels.

name: Beyond The Line with Francisco-Fernando Granados & Vessna Perunovich
description:
Through the art of performative storytelling, Fortitude/Fragile exhibiting artists Francisco-Fernando Granados and Vessna Perunovich delve into the complexities of lived and diasporic experiences. 

Granados and Perunovich use their artistic practices to shed light on narratives often marginalized or constrained by dominant systems of power, creating space for critical reflection and dialogue. By intertwining personal and collective histories, they evoke a nuanced understanding of resilience and vulnerability, offering audiences an intimate exploration of identity, displacement, and belonging.

name: A Glow in the Dark Paint Night Workshop
description:
Do something outside of the box with this unforgettable glow-in-the-dark paint night! Enjoy a guided sensory experience that will bring out your inner artist. Immerse yourself in our luminescent art studio and create a unique glowing masterpiece—no experience needed. Snacks and refreshments included.

Please see more Glow in the Dark Workshops here: https://www.artboxstudiogallery.com/glow-in-the-dark-paint

name: A Scented Candle Making Workshop
description:
Learn a new skill with this fun and relaxing activity that allows you to create two beautiful, custom candles. Select personalized scents, and work with organic soy wax which burns cleaner, and lasts longer. Take your candles home with you that day and enjoy your new custom scented creations.

Please see more Candle Making Workshops here: https://www.artboxstudiogallery.com/candle-making

name: After Dark Art Gallery + Drinks: An Augmented Reality Experience
description:
This unique event combines art and tech for a night to remember. Come experience art created by both humans and artificial intelligence, and interact with it through your mobile device. Socialize over drinks and learn more about art, technology, and AI.

- 19+ event
- For the best AR experience, your mobile device should have Chrome or Safari browsers

name: A Glow-in-the-Dark Paint Pouring Workshop
description:
Stimulate your senses as you play with glowing colours in our black light art studio. Let loose and express yourself in a fun and fluid way with this satisfying art technique. Embrace unpredictable patterns and create a piece of art as unique as a finger print. No experience needed!

Please see more Glow in the Dark Workshops here: https://www.artboxstudiogallery.com/glow-in-the-dark-paint

name: Community Environment Day at Allen Gardens
description:
Join Councillor Moise (Ward 13) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free loose compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted). Please bring a container to pick up loose compost.

name: Alone in the Dark – The Village at Black Creek
description: Join us for a spine-chilling paranormal adventure where intimate groups of 12 or fewer will have exclusive access to investigate haunted heritage buildings – including the notorious Half Way House – in the dark! Feel the chill of the night and listen to the whispers of the past as we employ ancient and modern techniques to attempt to establish contact with the lingering spirits that call the Village home. ‘Alone in the Dark’ is as real as it gets, nothing is hidden or staged. This unforgettably eerie evening will delight ghost story enthusiasts, fearless paranormal investigators, history aficionados, urban explorers, and anyone with a curiosity about the unknown. Book your spot now—spaces fill fast! All participants must be 16 or older.

name: Hidden Toronto City Tour

location.name: Tour starts outside of the Hockey Hall of Fame

description: Introducing “Hidden Toronto” – the new light-hearted walking tour from the creators of The Haunted Walk that’s gonna have you chuckling with laughter and shaking your head in disbelief. Join our crew of storytelling guides as we take you on a 90-minute adventure through the hidden side of Toronto. From movie mistakes to our infamous clown riot, these fun tales of mischief and mayhem make up the fascinating story of our city. Guffaw and gasp through the city’s streets as our fun and engaging tour guides spill the beans on those little-known stories and secrets that define Toronto’s hidden personality. “Hidden Toronto” is a fun and engaging good-natured adventure, perfect for first-time visitors and locals alike.

name: Ghosts of the Village at Black Creek
description: Join us as we explore the supernatural side of Toronto’s historic and haunted pioneer village Featuring some of the oldest buildings in the city it is the perfect creepy backdrop for a night of spine-tingling ghost stories. Many of which have occurred to previous village guests and Haunted Walk tour guides. It is easily one of the most active sites we tour and is a must-do for paranormal enthusiasts. Not recommended for children or easily frightened adults.

name: WonderPhil the Magician
description: WonderPhil creates the perfect balance of amazement and laughs to keep everyone entertained from beginning to end. After the show, adults and kids alike will be scratching their heads with wonder! His pet parrot Ha-Ha may stop in for a surprise visit too!

name: Sew & Soar: Spring Birding & Crafting

location.name: High Park Nature Centre Forest School

description:
Note: Pre-registration is required for all our events, hikes and workshops. We do this to ensure we don’t exceed our capacity for indoor events or the maximum limits for group sizes on High Park’s ecologically sensitive trails. 

Celebrate spring migration with birding and cheerful crafting! We’ll gather at the Nature Centre before heading into the park on a relaxed birding walk to spot spring’s arrivals and year-round residents. Our walk will finish at the Cottage (440 Parkside Dr.), where we’ll hand-sew felt birds inspired by the vibrant birdlife of High Park.

name: BACKYARD - Asian Night Market
description:
Join us for an unforgettable celebration of Asian Heritage Month right in the heart of Toronto. 

Enjoy flavours, artistry, and culture. Explore 50+ curated Asian-owned vendors. Savour authentic eats and drinks. Shop handmade candles, jewelry, art, fashion, and more. Enjoy a dynamic lineup of cultural performances, including two exclusive, never seen-before showcases. Dance into the night with live DJ sets spinning good vibes all evening long.

name: Celebrate Victoria Day at Arcadia Earth!
description:
Arcadia Earth invites families, kids, and curious minds to celebrate the season and the planet with a weekend full of creativity, discovery, and eco-conscious fun. Alongside its inspiring multi-sensory exhibits, guests can enjoy free sustainable crafts and activities daily from 12:00 pm - 5:00 pm, including:

Clothespin Butterflies - eco-friendly fun with spring-inspired flair

DIY Bookmarks - made with upcycled materials for readers of all ages

AR Colouring - bring your art to life through augmented reality!

name: Saturday Afternoon Eurovision Tribute Party - Queer O-Vision
description: Watch Eurovision 2025 live with friends, flags, and fierce outfits. Dress like your fave contestant, past or present, and get ready to vote, yell, and maybe cry.

name: A Tribute to the Honey Bee
description: Celebrate World Bee Day with a photo exhibition by Craig Symonds, presented as part of the 2025 CONTACT Photography Festival. Experience an immersive installation that captures the beauty and importance of honey bees in our world. A large-scale window display will also be on view throughout the month of May.

name: International Food & Drink Festival
description: A celebration of food and culture showcasing flavours from around the world against the stunning backdrop of the city’s waterfront. Indulge in a diverse selection of international cuisine, from sizzling street food to gourmet specialties. Sip on beer, wine, cider, spirits and cocktails while enjoying live music, a marketplace, busker performances, interactive cooking demonstrations and more.

name: Breakthrough Healing with Tao
description: Step into a transformative experience where ancient wisdom meets modern-day healing. This is your chance to be with Master Sha and his leading teachers in a warm, supportive space. Together, you'll explore simple yet powerful techniques and receive blessings that can help you release blockages, find balance, and reconnect with your true self. Whether you're seeking clarity, strength, or just a reset, this experience is here to leave you feeling renewed and inspired - at your own pace and in your own way.

name: Story of a Day – Scéal Lae
description:
This magical, music-filled journey explores how the ordinary transforms into the extraordinary through one child’s day. A playful, poetic celebration of the little moments in life, this performance invites young audiences to explore the world with new eyes. 

Featuring original music by Tom Lane and vibrant illustrations by Mary Murphy, this performance is perfect for children aged four and up (and their families).

name: 2025 Asian Heritage Culture Festival
description: Join us for a unique celebration with performing arts events, art exhibitions, Asian fashion shows, food vendors, booths, kids' bouncy castles, and more!

name: Hocus Pocus
description:
From the sky to the ocean depths, two illusionist dancers find themselves in the middle of a surreal universe and dreamlike adventures as they tumble through clouds and dive into the sea to meet otherworldly creatures.

This poetic coming-of-age story, imagined by Swiss choreographer Philippe Saire, is part dance, part performance art where bodies, faces and props appear and disappear as if by magic.

Hocus Pocus is appropriate for ages seven and up.
